Crime_Name: Judicial Review of Public Service Appeal Board Decision
Legal_Issue: Whether the second selection process was a new process or a corrective measure; authority of the Commission under PSEA
Decision_Outcome: Appeal Board's decision upheld; judicial review application dismissed
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate error by Appeal Board
Legal_Rule: PSEA subsection 21(3) allows Commission to take corrective measures; subsection 21(2) mandates revocation on successful appeal; section 10 emphasizes merit-based selection
Procedural_Issue: Nature of the second selection process – new competition vs. corrective action
Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that Appeal Board erred in characterizing the process as new rather than corrective
Outcome_on_Merits: No error found; Commission had authority to direct a new process
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process found to be procedurally fair and within statutory authority
Key_Evidence_Considered: Commission's letter stating intent to conduct a new competition
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged characterization of second selection process and Commission's authority
Court_Result: Judicial review dismissed; no costs awarded
Defendant_Response: Commission acted within its authority under PSEA
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of Appeal Board decision and reinstatement of original appointment
Claimant_Status: Unsuccessful applicants in public service competition
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Error in law or jurisdiction by Appeal Board
Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
